sen.j: 屯田
sen.e: Tonden
Tonden
Tonden

sen.j: 屯田（とんでん）は、兵士による開拓・駐屯の制度。
sen.e: Tonden was the system of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers.
Tonden was the system of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers.
Tonden was the system of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers.

sen.j: 屯田（みた）は、日本古代の皇室領。
sen.e: Mita was the land owned by the Imperial Family in ancient Japan.
Mita was the land owned by the Imperial Family in ancient Japan.
Mita was the land owned by the Imperial Family in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 兵士による開拓・駐屯の制度
sen.e: System of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers
System of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers
System of opening up of new territory and colonization by soldiers

sen.j: 屯田（とんでん）は、一般に、兵士に新しく耕地を開墾させ、平時は農業を行って自らを養い、戦時には軍隊に従事させる制度、またその場所や地域を言う。
sen.e: Tonden was a system or the place, region were soldiers plowed new were recruited at war time but farmed the land to sustain themselves at peace time,
Tonden refers to a system or the place/region where soldiers plowed new fields were recruited at war time but farmed the land to sustain themselves at peace time,
Tonden refers to a system or the place/region where soldiers who were made to plow new fields were recruited at war time but farmed the land to sustain themselves at peace time.
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 中国
sen.e: China
China
China

sen.j: 前漢の武帝は、辺境地帯を防衛する兵士に農耕を行わせた（軍屯）。
sen.e: Emperor Wu of the Former Han (dynasty of China) had soldiers who guarded the outlying areas farm the land (Gunton).
Emperor Wu of the Former Han (dynasty of China) had soldiers who guarded the outlying areas farm the land (Gunton).
Emperor Wu of the Former Han (dynasty of China) had soldiers who guarded the outlying areas farm the land (Gunton).
sen.cmt: スペースを追加しました。

sen.j: 魏 (三国)の曹操は、韓浩・棗祗らの提言に従って屯田制を導入した。
sen.e: Cao Cao of Wei dynasty (Three States Period) introduced the Tonden system following the advice of his advisors.
sen.cmt: 韓浩・棗祗->日本語ではかんこう、そうし、という読みですが、英訳が見つかりません。
sen.e: Cao Cao of the Wei dynasty (Three States Period) introduced the Tonden system following the advice of his advisors.
Cao Cao of the Wei dynasty (Three States Period) introduced the Tonden system following the advice of his advisors, Han Hao and Zao Zhi.
sen.cmt: 韓浩・棗祗 読みを追加しました。

sen.j: これは、辺境地帯でなく内地において、荒廃した田畑を一般の人民にあてがって耕作させるもの（民屯）で、当初は許都の周辺で行われ、のち各地に広まった。
sen.e: This was not in the outlying areas but inland and had ordinary citizens farm land that had not been used (Minton) and was originally started around Xuchang and then spread to other regions.
This was not in the outlying areas but inland and had ordinary citizens farm land that had not been used (Minton) and was originally started around Xuchang and then spread to other regions.
This was not in the outlying areas but inland and had ordinary citizens farm land that had not been used (Minton) and was originally started around Xuchang and then spread to other regions.

sen.j: 屯田制下の人民は、各郡の典農中郎将、各県の典農都尉によって、一般の農村行政とは別に軍事組織と結びついた形で統治された。
sen.e: The citizens under the Tonden system were controlled separately from ordinary agricultural management and linked to military organizations by the Tennochurosho in each gun, Tennotoi in each prefecture.

The citizens under the Tonden system were controlled separately from ordinary agricultural management and linked to military organizations by the Tennochurosho in each gun, Tennotoi in each prefecture.

The citizens under the Tonden system were controlled separately from ordinary agricultural management and linked to military organizations by the Tennochurosho in each district, Tennotoi in each prefecture.

sen.j: 司馬懿の提言で、長期にわたる抗争を繰り広げていた呉 (三国)・蜀それぞれの国境付近（淮河流域、関中）でも軍屯が展開され、これにより安定した食糧供給を維持した魏は、両国との争いを有利に進めた。
sen.e: With the suggestion of Sima Yi, Gunton were developed near the border with Go(Three States Period) and Shu, countries that had long been in battle with and Weii was able to have a stable supply of provisions, which was advantageous in fighting these two countries.

With the suggestion of Sima Yi, Gunton were developed near the border with the Go (Three States Period) and Shu, countries that they had long been in battle with and Weii was able to have a stable supply of provisions, which was advantageous in fighting these two countries.

With the suggestion of Sima Yi, Gunton were developed near the borders with the Go (Three States Period) (area along the Huai River) and Shu (Guanzhong), countries that they had long been in battle with, and Wei was able to have a stable supply of provisions, which was advantageous in fighting these two countries.
sen.cmt: （淮河流域、関中） 翻訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 晋の時代になると民屯が廃止され、軍屯のみが残った。
sen.e: In the Jin period, Minton was abolished and Gunton remained.
In the Jin period, Minton was abolished and Gunton remained.
In the Jin period, Minton was abolished and Gunton remained.

sen.j: こうした国家が土地・人民を直接に管理・支配しようとする試みは、のちの均田制にも通じるものであったといえる。
sen.e: Such attempts of direct control and management of land and people by the government can be considered to be linked with the Kinden system of later years.
Such attempts of direct control and management of land and people by the government can be considered to be linked with the Kinden system of later years.
Such attempts of direct control and management of land and people by the government can be considered to be linked with the Kinden system of later years.

sen.j: 日本
sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

sen.j: 明治時代に屯田兵が北海道で開墾に従事した。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, Tonden soldiers opened up new land in Hokkaido.
During the Meiji period, Tonden soldiers opened up new land in Hokkaido.
During the Meiji period, Tonden soldiers opened up new land in Hokkaido.

sen.j: この制度を屯田兵制という。
sen.e: This system was called the Tonden hei system.
This system was called the Tonden hei system.
This system was called the Tonden hei system.

sen.j: 札幌市北区にある屯田 (札幌市北区)（とんでん）、中央区 (札幌市)山鼻の東屯田通駅、西屯田通は、屯田兵が駐屯したことから付けられた地名である。
sen.e: Tonden in Kita Ward, Sapporo City, Higashi Tonden dori station and Nishi Tonden dori-street in Yamahana, Chuo Ward, Sapporo City were place names because tonden soldiers stayed there.
Tonden in Kita Ward, Sapporo City, Higashi Tonden dori station and Nishi Tonden dori-street in Yamahana, Chuo Ward, Sapporo City were place names because tonden soldiers stayed there.
Tonden in Kita Ward, Sapporo City, Higashi Tonden-dori Station and Nishi Tonden-dori Street in Yamahana, Chuo Ward, Sapporo City were place names because tonden soldiers stayed there.
sen.cmt: 地名などの表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 日本古代の皇室領
sen.e: Ancient Japanese Imperial Family lands
Ancient Japanese Imperial Family lands
Ancient Japanese Imperial Family lands

sen.j: 屯田（みた）は、大王 (ヤマト王権)の直接支配する田地。
sen.e: Mita were fields that the Daio (Yamato kingdom) directly controlled.
Mita were fields that the Daio (Yamato kingdom) directly controlled.
Mita were fields that the Daio (Yamato kingdom) directly controlled.

sen.j: その管理のために置かれたのが屯倉である。
sen.e: Miyake were placed for management of Mita.
Miyake were placed for management of Mita.
Miyake were placed for management of Mita.

sen.j: 大宝令では屯田、養老令で官田といわれているもの。
sen.e: In the Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code),, they are called Mita, the Yoro-ryo (Yoro Code) calls them Kanden.
In the Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code), they were called Mita, the Yoro-ryo (Yoro Code) calls them Kanden.
In the Taiho-ryo (Taiho Code), they were called Mita, the Yoro-ryo (Yoro Code) calls them Kanden.

sen.j: 大和・摂津に30町、河内・山城に20町と規定された。
sen.e: It was designated to be 30-cho in Yamato/Settsu, and 20-cho in Kawachi/Yamashiro.
It was designated to be 30-cho in Yamato/Settsu, and 20-cho in Kawachi/Yamashiro.
It was designated to be 30-cho in Yamato/Settsu, and 20-cho in Kawachi/Yamashiro.

sen.j: 全国に点在する「富田」（とんでん・とんだ・とみた）と呼ばれる地名は、その多くが屯田が転じたものであると考えられている。
sen.e: Many of the place names that are called "Tonden, Tonda, Tomita" scattered throughout the country are considered to be a transformation from "Tonden".
Many of the place names that are called "Tonden, Tonda, Tomita" scattered throughout the country are considered to be a transformation from "Tonden."
Many of the place names that are called 'Tonden,' 'Tonda' and 'Tomita' scattered throughout the country are considered to be a transformation from Tonden.
